sentences: Ohoh, ma ei teadnudki, et sa nii kibe vene keele mees oled!
Ütlete ju, et teil alati kangesti kibe on.
context: The word 'teadnudki' is a combination of the Estonian verb 'teadma' (to know) and the particle 'ki' which adds emphasis. In this context from the dictionary definition, it appears in the example sentence where someone expresses surprise at discovering another person's skill level: 'Ohoh, ma ei teadnudki, et sa nii kibe vene keele mees oled!' (Ohoh, I didn't know that you're such an expert in Russian!). The 'teadnudki' here means 'I didn't even/actually know' with the particle adding emphasis to the realization.
